questions.question_text:
Cisco Expressways are being deployed for Mobile and Remote Access. The Expressway-E internal interface (LAN1) IP is 192.168.100.10/24, and the external interface (LAN2) IP is 172.16.100.10/24.
The Expressway-C IP is 192.168.20.10/24. The default gateway for each subnet is the first useable address. How must the Expressway-E be configured to allow proper routing to the internal and external networks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Yes we all agree D

Selected Answer: D
Should be D 
route to subnet of internal network

comments.content: Agreed. The internal interface is outside of the Exp-C subnet range.

discussion.content:
Answer should be D.
Static routes are needed to the Exp-C network

choices.B: IPv4 gateway: 192.168.100.1, and a static route for the 192.168.20.0/24 subnet using LAN1
choices.C: IPv4 gateway: 192.168.100.1, and a static route for the 172.16.100.0/24 subnet using LAN2
choices.A: IPv4 gateway: 172.16.100.1, and a static route for the 192.168.100.0/24 subnet using LAN1
choices.D: IP v4 gateway: 172.16.100.1, and a static route for the 192.168.20.0/24 subnet using LAN1

choices.B: Add a rule with the URL http://server1.example.com:80/ to the inbound HTTP allow list manually to allow access to the new web server.
choices.D: Run an IM and Presence server discovery process on Expressway-C to add the new web server to the inbound HTTP allow list automatically.
choices.C: Add a rule with the server IP address 10.1.1.90 in the URL to the inbound HTTP allow list because server names and FQDNs are not supported.
choices.A: Add a rule with the URL http://server1.example.com:80/ to the outbound HTTP allow list manually to allow pushing the new software to the clients.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cert Guide:
You cannot add outbound rules to the HTTP allow list. In addition, you can’t edit or delete auto-added rules in the list
You can add your own inbound rules to the HTTP allow list if remote clients need to access other web services inside the enterprise.

comments.content: you can not create outbound HTTP allow list

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
administrator can add a rule with the URL `http://server1.example.com:80/` to the **outbound HTTP allow list** on the Expressway server. This will allow the Expressway server to access the new web server and retrieve the Jabber update files, which can then be pushed to the clients.

questions.question_text: An administrator installs a new webserver (server1.example.com – 10.1.1.90) for storing Cisco Jabber update files to the network, but all Mobile and Remote Access registered clients still run the old Jabber software version, and the update fails. Which configuration task on an Expressway server solves the Jabber software update issue?

choices.C: remove each Expressway peer from the cluster
choices.B: upgrade each Expressway peer to the latest Expressway software
choices.D: add all the Expressway peers to the cluster
choices.A: use the backup that is specific to each Expressway peer in the cluster

questions.question_text: What is the first step to restoring an Expressway cluster from a backup?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To restore a backup, you need to take the Cisco Expressway unit out of service before doing a restore. If you are doing a restore on a clustered Cisco Expressway, you need to first remove it from the cluster. You cannot restore a backup on a node that is still a member of a cluster. Use a standalone Cisco Expressway to restore it to a previous configuration of system data.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure Mobile and Remote Access. One of the requirements is to expect Cisco Jabber users to enter username@cisco.com as the login userid. Which DNS record must the engineer modify to start implementing this requirement?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. When Expressway-E routes a call with URI 4040@uclab.local to a DNS zone, which DNS server does the Expressway query for the SIP SRV records?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
As well as the five default DNS servers, you can specify up to five additional explicit DNS servers for specified domains. This can be useful in deployments where specific domain hierarchies need to be routed to their explicit authorities.
